page.title: 01TRENT VALLEY:ELSTON/MORTON
page.content: This is essentially a rural area of gently rolling countryside devoted to arable farming. It is divided into two by the{River Trent}, which meanders across the region from the SW to the NE corner of the block. At the present day there is no river crossing within the block. A steep escarpment that leads down to the village of{Elston}in the extreme SE corner lies to the south-east of the{River Trent}.{Elston and {East Stoke}are the only villages within the block,{Elston}being the larger of the two. The area touches the outer fringes of{Gibsmere,Morton and{Fiskerton.}The{Fosse Way}(A46), which runs across the plateau on the south side of the river through{East {Stoke,}is the only major road.
